source_input:
German Credit Dataset Background: Originally collected in the 1973-1975 period from a German bank, it contains 1,000 instances with 20 attributes (7 numerical and 13 categorical). The class distribution is imbalanced with 700 good credit risks and 300 bad credit risks.

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of no checking account, applies for a loan for 15 months, with a credit history of critical account or other credits existing (not at this bank), for the purpose of buying radio/television, with a credit amount of 1459 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for 1 to 4 years, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is female, divorced, separated, or married, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 2 years, owns a car or other property, aged 40-44 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, unskilled resident, liable for maintenance of 1 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: no

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of at least 200 DM or salary assignments for at least 1 year, applies for a loan for 4 months, with a credit history of existing credits paid back duly till now, for the purpose of buying a new car, with a credit amount of 1494 DM, with unknown or no savings account, employed for less than 1 year, and an installment rate 1% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 2 years, owns real estate, aged 25-29 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, unskilled resident, liable for maintenance of 2 people, no telephone, and is not a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: no

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of between 0 and 200 DM, applies for a loan for 15 months, with a credit history of existing credits paid back duly till now, for the purpose of buying radio/television, with a credit amount of 802 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for at least 7 years, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 3 years, owns a car or other property, aged 35-39 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, skilled employee or official, liable for maintenance of 2 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: yes

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of between 0 and 200 DM, applies for a loan for 45 months, with a credit history of existing credits paid back duly till now, for the purpose of buying radio/television, with a credit amount of 3031 DM, with savings between 100 and 500 DM, employed for 1 to 4 years, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, with a guarantor, living at current residence for 4 years, has building society savings agreement or life insurance, aged 20-24 years, no other installment plans, housing: rent, with 1 existing credits at this bank, skilled employee or official, liable for maintenance of 1 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: yes

Question:
A customer who has a checking account status of between 0 and 200 DM, applies for a loan for 48 months, with a credit history of existing credits paid back duly till now, for the purpose of buying radio/television, with a credit amount of 5951 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for 1 to 4 years, and an installment rate 2% of disposable income, personal status is female, divorced, separated, or married, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 2 years, owns real estate, aged 20-24 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, skilled employee or official, liable for maintenance of 1 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer:
model_output: Yes): Another customer with low checking account balance, high credit amount, and purpose of buying radio/television. They were employed for 1-4 years, had a guarantor, and other liabilities. The answer was "yes" due to the combination of high debt and limited income sources.

source_input:
German Credit Dataset Background: Originally collected in the 1973-1975 period from a German bank, it contains 1,000 instances with 20 attributes (7 numerical and 13 categorical). The class distribution is imbalanced with 700 good credit risks and 300 bad credit risks.

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of no checking account, applies for a loan for 11 months, with a credit history of critical account or other credits existing (not at this bank), for the purpose of buying a new car, with a credit amount of 1393 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for less than 1 year, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is female, divorced, separated, or married, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 4 years, owns a car or other property, aged 35-39 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 2 existing credits at this bank, management/self-employed/highly qualified employee/officer, liable for maintenance of 1 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: no

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of between 0 and 200 DM, applies for a loan for 18 months, with a credit history of delay in paying off in the past, for the purpose of repairs, with a credit amount of 6204 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for 1 to 4 years, and an installment rate 2% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 4 years, owns real estate, aged 40-44 years, no other installment plans, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, unskilled resident, liable for maintenance of 2 people, telephone registered under the customer's name, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: no

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of between 0 and 200 DM, applies for a loan for 18 months, with a credit history of critical account or other credits existing (not at this bank), for the purpose of buying a new car, with a credit amount of 884 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for at least 7 years, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 4 years, owns a car or other property, aged 35-39 years, has other installment plans at a bank, housing: own, with 1 existing credits at this bank, skilled employee or official, liable for maintenance of 2 people, telephone registered under the customer's name, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: yes

Example:
A customer who has a checking account status of no checking account, applies for a loan for 12 months, with a credit history of critical account or other credits existing (not at this bank), for the purpose of business, with a credit amount of 2292 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, currently unemployed, and an installment rate 4% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, no other debtors or guarantors, living at current residence for 2 years, owns a car or other property, aged 40-44 years, has installment plans at stores, housing: own, with 2 existing credits at this bank, management/self-employed/highly qualified employee/officer, liable for maintenance of 1 people, telephone registered under the customer's name, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer: yes

Question:
A customer who has a checking account status of less than 0 DM, applies for a loan for 42 months, with a credit history of existing credits paid back duly till now, for the purpose of purchasing furniture/equipment, with a credit amount of 7882 DM, with savings less than 100 DM, employed for 4 to 7 years, and an installment rate 2% of disposable income, personal status is male, single, with a guarantor, living at current residence for 4 years, has building society savings agreement or life insurance, aged 45-49 years, no other installment plans, housing: for free, with 1 existing credits at this bank, skilled employee or official, liable for maintenance of 2 people, no telephone, and is a foreign worker. Predict whether this customer is likely to default on the loan. Answer yes or no.
Answer:
